briefTitle: Study Of Azithromycin Intravenous Formulation Against Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) In Japan
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Non-Randomized, Open Label Study Of Azithromycin Intravenous Followed By Oral Administration In Japanese Adult Subjects With Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) Requiring Initial Intravenous Therapy

arms.label: Azithromycin switch therapy (switch from intravenous to oral).

summary: Azithromycin had a potent in vitro activities and broad spectrum from typical and atypical bacteria to anaerobes. Azithromycin intravenous formulation demonstrated high efficacy and eradication rate in the western clinical trials. Development of azithromycin intravenous formulation would bring the clinical benefit to patients with pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) in Japan.
